intro: Syrrheonema, commonly known as the golden thread plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Syrrheonema species are known for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and unique floral structure. They are also sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
